parameters.definition: Maximum number of mines that can be operated in a year
Royalty cost for operating mine k
Quality of the material from mine k
Required quality of the material for client i
Price per unit of material sold
Discount on the royalty cost per unit of material sold

description: To maximize profit, which mines should be operated each year and how much should they produce? The company has \param{K} mines and can operate at most \param{MaxWork} in any given year. For each mine k, there is a royalty cost of \param{Royalty}, a production limit of \param{Limit}, and the material extracted has a quality of \param{Quality}. Each client i requires a material with at least \param{RequiredQuality}. The price per unit of material sold is \param{Price}, with a discount \param{Discount} applied to the royalty cost for each unit sold.
